results.title: The Chateau country
results.creator_credit: French Government Tourist Office and Vavin
results.brief_description: A tour of the Renaissance castles of the Loire Valley. Rambouillet, summer residence of the French President; Blois, with its historical associations; Chateau Renault, court of the Valois and Orleans kings; Amboise with the chapel of St Hubert; Chinon, associated with Joan of Arc; and much more.

results.title: The Chain of life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Vanishing Wilderness”.
Man is destroying his environment when he uses chemical instead of biological pesticide controls. Man is the end link in the chain of life and is limiting his own survival when he destroys other links in that chain.

results.title: Santa Barbara: everybody's mistake
results.creator_credit: Shelly Grossman and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Vanishing Wilderness”.
Examines the controversies behind the 2 million gallon oil leak in the Santa Barbara Channel, off the coast of California in 1969. Shows how smog created by oil is killing pine trees high above sea level. The film asks why a society places such a high value on oil that it willingly endangers its own life. Based on the book “Our Vanishing Wilderness” by Mary Louise and Shelly Grossman and John Hamlet.

results.title: Slow death of desert water
results.creator_credit: Shelly Grossman and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Vanishing Wilderness”.
Shows what is happening to Pyramid Lake, in Nevada, and its wild life because dams divert its source of water and sonic booms frighten its wild life. Based on the book “Our vanishing wilderness” by Mary Louise and Shelly Grossman and John Hamlet, 1969.

results.title: The Chain gang
results.creator_credit: A Zegenhagen and English, Scottish and Australian Bank Film Unit
results.brief_description: Training film for bank tellers, aiming to foster customer loyalty by making the customer feel welcome, important and at ease. The chain of branches is 500 strong and each individual bank throughout Australia is important as a link in the chain. Personal attention is shown to be vital in the formation of the customer’s image of the bank.

results.title: The Centigram beam balance
results.brief_description: Instructional film showing: use of measuring instruments; preparation of balance for use; levelling and adjusting the beam; use of weights; technique of weighing; checking the weight; packing up weight and closing the balance case.

results.title: The Centenary test
results.brief_description: This film consists of highlights from the 1977 Centenary Test Match played at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, March 12th-17th, between Australia and England. It contains interviews by Richie Benaud with former and current players of both teams and commentators include Norman May, Frank Tyson, Jim Laker, Keith Miller and Paul Sheahan.

results.title: The Case of the missing magnets
results.brief_description: Reviews the basic principles of human relations, and the problem of motivating employees to better teamwork, and productivity. A dramatization helps supervisors understand that discipline goes hand-in-hand with human relations in moulding an effective team.

results.title: The Case against rubella
results.brief_description: Shows rubella-damaged children with various handicaps, including blindness and brain damage. Outlines the history of the disease and stresses that Rubella and its serious consequences can now be prevented by newly developed vaccines. Briefly shows research efforts and how the vaccines are to be used
